alert.note: Alert for Rockland (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 2:14PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern Passaic, northern Bergen and Rockland Counties through 300 PM EDT... At 214 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hawthorne, or over Ridgewood, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Paterson, Wayne, Paramus, Ridgewood, Ramsey, Suffern, Tappan, Hawthorne, Pearl River, Oradell, Orangeburg, Fair Lawn, Elmwood Park, Wyckoff and Oakland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
